alert.note: Alert for Bernalillo; Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 12:29PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Bernalillo. In north central New Mexico, Sandoval. * WHEN...Until 230 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1229 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving showers. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northeastern Albuquerque, Tijeras, Sandia Heights, Cedar Crest and Carnuel. - This includes the following low water crossings... Knight Lane in Carnuel, Richfield Ave and Eubank NE, Holbrook St and Alameda NE, Eagle Rock Ave NE between Tennyson and Lowell, Modesto Ave NE between Tennyson and Lowell, Glendale Ave and Browning St NE, Bobcat Blvd NE at Domingo Baca Arroyo, Spring Creek Dr NE Sandia Heights North, Tierra Monte Dr NE near FR 333, Live Oak Loop NE Sandia Heights, Live Oak Court to Tramway Ln NE Sandia Heights, Browning St NE between Anaheim and Corona Ave NE and Corona Ave NE between Browning and Eubank NE. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 164 and 174. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas.
